title: Rotational equilibrium torque graph and velocity

content.question: A horizontal circular disk is mounted on a vertical axle through its center, and rotates on the axle with negligible friction. The disk is initially at rest, and a graph of the net torque <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ï„</mi></math> exerted on the disk as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is shown. During which interval(s) of time, if any, is the angular velocity of the disk constant?

choices.label: Between <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> only

Between <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and between <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>

Between <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> only

At no time between <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> seconds is the angular velocity of the disk constant.

content.answer: Between <math alttext="t equals 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> only

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
